section.name: Delve into Hippo CMS
section.p: The Hippo CMS component of the Hippo ECM can manage all content in your company. The userinterface is webbased: content is created and managed via your normal webbrowser, anywhere you have access to your companies intranet. Several users may work on the same document, picture, soundtrack or other piece of content. Rights to change pieces of content or just to read them can be assigned. Previous versions of content are stored automatically. Advanced methods to search content are provided.

Companies that use Hippo CMS, design their own content structure. Hippo CMS ensures that all content fits into this single structure. Thus, the content base of the company will be filled with information actually useful to the company; required information will actually be there and the content base will be easily understandable and searchable, thanks to its uniformity.

td.p: You can try out Hippo CMS with example content having predefined structure, to see possible features `in action', before designing your own content structure. To install Hippo CMS with example content, download a quickstart Hippo CMS package. After you studied the example content, your system adminstrator can configure the package for actual use in your company.

tr.td:
Hippo CMS User Guide
If you are a (new) user to Hippo CMS and the Hippo CMS is already installed on your system, read the User Guide for a tour through Hippo CMS and to learn Hippo CMS concepts.

td.p: Here, all system administration information for Hippo CMS can found, i.e. installation and configuration. The description of installation includes details not in the quickstart guide. Configuration of Hippo CMS is often as simple as adding the path to your companies data base server. Without this path, Hippo CMS will use a folder on your filesystem to store the content.
If a quickstart package was installed, configuration for actual use requires two settings that ensure that the example content is not used and not recreated on your data base server.
The Hippo ECM can be tailored to your needs, augmented with your own website-design, and integrated with your other applications to create your own Hippo ECM implementation.
This guides describes the CMS related aspects of the Hippo ECM implementation.

tr.td:
CMS Extension Guide
This guide is for developers of custom plugins for Hippo CMS. Examples are plugins for extra properties of content nodes and plugins for custom userinterfaces for the Hippo CMS.

CMS Developers Guide
This guide is for Hippo CMS developers, who develop the CMS core engines and the CMS core plugins and the CMS standard package, containing the CMS core engines and a selection of the CMS core plugins.
